org.sd.cio.mapreduce
Class MapReduceBase<K,V,A,R>

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.cio.mapreduce.MapReduceBase<K,V,A,R>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, Governable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Mapper, Reducer
public abstract class MapReduceBase<K,V,A,R>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Governable

Base map and reduce process definition utility.

This class serves as a container for common functionality across both map and reduce processes. Consumers should extend either the Mapper or Reducer instead of this base class.

Extenders of Mapper or Reducer must implement the following methods from this base class:

  • For specifying the input:
    • getRootInputFile() -- identify the top directory containing input.
    • selectDirectory() -- identify actions to take with each input directory encountered.
    • selectFile() -- identify input files to operate on.
  • For specifying the output:
    • buildFlushActionFactory -- specify output naming and flushing.
  • NOTE: implementation of Mapper and Reducer abstract methods will allow specification of the operations to perform on the data including details of handling input and output formats.

Author:
Spence Koehler

getRootOutputFile

protected abstract java.io.File getRootOutputFile()
Get the root output file (directory) to which flushed output directories and/or files will be flushed.

NOTE: It is the output from this method that will be fed as input to buildFlushActionFactory.

selectDirectory

protected abstract DirectorySelector.Action selectDirectory(java.io.File dir)
Apply directory selection criterea to the given directory.

selectFile

protected abstract boolean selectFile(java.io.File file)
Apply file selection criterea to the given file.

buildFlushActionFactory

protected abstract FlushActionFactory<K,V,A> buildFlushActionFactory(java.io.File outDir)
Build the flush action factory to provide for capturing processing output.

NOTE: A typical implementation of this will usually require a custom class that extends AbstractFlushActionFactory and maintains data structures for each flush action that can be communicated across methods. In particular the mapper's "operate" method will likely need access to these data structures.

Parameters:
outDir - The root output directory under which to build flush directories and/or files. The directory that is sent into this method invocation during initialize will be the result from getRootOutputFile.

buildWalker

protected abstract DirWalker buildWalker()
Build the appropriate DirWalker instance for performing the map or reduce task.

getFlushActionFactory

protected final FlushActionFactory<K,V,A> getFlushActionFactory()
Accessor for flush action factory instance.

NOTE: This instance is not available until during walker.run(), which is after preRunHook has been invoked.

run

public void run()
Run the DirWalker.

If the preRunHook is successful, initialization will be invoked and the walker will be run; after which, the flush action factory will be finalized and the postRunHook will be invoked.

If an IOException occurs during the processing, it will be rethrown as an IllegalStateException.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

preRunHook

protected boolean preRunHook()
Perform any pre-initialization operations.

This is intended to be overridden by implementations that require additional setup before initialization and running.

Returns:
true to continue with initialization and running or false to abort execution immediately.

postRunHook

protected void postRunHook()
Perform any post-run operations.

This is intended to be overridden by implementations that require additional functionality or cleanup after the walker execution is complete and the flush action factory has been finalized.

getVerbose

protected boolean getVerbose()
Access whether verbosity should be turned on inside of the DirWalker while it runs.

This is intended to be overridden by implmentations to inject the verbose flag into the DirWalker execution.

Returns:
true for verbosity in the DirWalker or false (default).

buildDirectorySelector

protected final DirectorySelector buildDirectorySelector()
Helper method for bulding a directory selector that uses this class's selectDirectory method.

buildFileSelector

protected final FileSelector buildFileSelector()
Helper method for building a file selector that uses this class's selectFile method.

getCurrentInputFile

protected java.io.File getCurrentInputFile()
Do the work of getting the current input file.

Note that this method can be overridden so that the input file can be more flexibly specified when needed.

In this default implementation, the result from getRootInputFile is always returned.

getCurrentOutputFile

protected java.io.File getCurrentOutputFile()
Do the work of getting the current output file.

Note that this method can be overridden so that the output file can be more flexibly specified when needed.

In this default implementation, the result from getRootOutputFile is always returned.
